description.en: This course gives an overview different partial differential equations arising in mathematical finance, their derivation procedures and numerical solution methods. In the computer labs students acquire practical skills for computing the prices of various financial options.
description.et: Kursus annab ülevaate finantsmatemaatikas tekkivate osatuletistega diferentsiaalvõrrandite tekkemehhanismidest ning põhiomadustest, samuti nende numbrilise lahendamise erinevatest meetoditest. Praktikumides õpitakse neid arvutusmeetodeid kasutama lihtsamate optsioonide hindade arvutamiseks.

objectives.en: The goals of the course are
1. To give an overview of basic properties and derivation procedures of the partial differential equations arising in mathematical finance
objectives.et: 1. Anda ülevaade finantsmatemaatikas tekkivate osatuletistega diferentsiaalvõrrandite tuletamise skeemidest ning põhiomadustest

objectives.en: 2. To introduce the basic procedures of  the derivation process of numerical methods for computing the prices of financial options and to give practical skills for computing the prices of common options
objectives.et: 2. Tutvustada optsioonide hindamisega seotud arvutusmeetodite tuletuskäike ning anda praktilised oskused lihtsamate optsioonide hindade praktiliseks arvutamiseks

objectives.en: 3. To give practical skills of estimating the parameters of some popular market models and for computing the quantities that are necessary for constructing hedging portfolios.
objectives.et: 3. Anda praktilised oskused lihtsamate turumudelite parameetrite hindamiseks ning optsioonide müügiga seotud riskide maandamiseks vajalike arvutuste teostamiseks

learning_outcomes.en: After completing the course the student
1. understands the procedure of derivation of partial differential equations for option prices;
learning_outcomes.et: 1. Saab aru erinevate optsioonide hindade jaoks osatuletistega diferentsiaalvõrrandi tuletamise skeemist;

learning_outcomes.en: 2. Is able to derive various finite difference methods for solving the partial differential equations of mathematical finance
learning_outcomes.et: 2. oskab tuletada erinevat tüüpi võrgumeetodeid finantsmatemaatikas tekkivate osatuletistega diferentsiaalvõrrandite lahendamiseks;

learning_outcomes.en: 3. Is able to implement the numerical methods as computer codes in a high level language
learning_outcomes.et: 3. oskab realiseerida programme erinevat tüüpi optsioonide hindade numbriliseks arvutamiseks;

learning_outcomes.en: 4. Knows how to estimate the actual error of the result of a numerical method and is able to use the skills for computing the prices of concrete options with a prescribed accuracy.
learning_outcomes.et: 4. tunneb numbriliste meetodite kasutamisel tekkivate vigade praktilise hindamise võtteid ning oskab neid konkreetsete optsioonide hindade arvutamisel kasutada.

independent_work.et: There are 10 homework assignments (7 practical and 3 theoretical) that have to be solved within 8 calendar days, instructions will be given together with assignments and can also be found in the course web page. Solutions to practical homework assignments have to be submitted through the course home page, theoretical homework can  be submitted on a paper in class or submitted electronically through the course home page.

description.et:
Kirjalik eksam koosneb kahest teoreetilisest ja kahest praktilisest (arvuti abil lahendatavast) ülesandest, mille eest on kokku lõpphinde arvestusse saada kuni 60 punkti
Written final examination consists of two theoretical and two practical (solved by writing a computer program) problems, for which it is possible to earn up to 60 points in total

Kursuse jooksul tuleb lahendada kolm teoreetilist ja 7 praktilist (arvuti abil lahendatavat) ülesannet, mis igaüks on väärt 4 punkti. Eksamile pääsemiseks tuleb koguda kodutööde eest vähemalt 20 punkti
There are 3 theoretical and 7 practical homework problems, each one worth 4 points. It is necessary to collect at least 20 points to be eligible for the final examination

grade_preconditions.et: In order to qualify for the final exam, at least 20 points (50%) for homework assignments is required

grade_evaluation.et: 60% of the final score is given by the final exam, 40% comes from the homework assignments. The final exam consists of a theoretical part (derivation of a numerical method) and a computational part (pricing of a concrete option)

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

description.et: Introduction to Python programming language. Basic constructions in Python
Definition of a financial option, types of options, Black-Scholes market model
Self-financing investment strategies, Arbitrage principle. Black-Scholes market model. Euler-Maruyama method.
Implemention of Black-Scholes formulas. The idea of interpolation.
Generating stock prices according to  a market model .
Fitting a market model to historical data. Maximal likelihood method.
Fitting a market model to historical data Checking the goodness of fit.
Fitting a market model by using observed option prices. Option prices as expected values. Monte-Carlo method for option pricing.
A procedure of computing the price of an option with given accuracy by using MC method. Derivation of Black-Scholes equation.
Estimation of volatility by using observed option prices. Implementation of MC method for option pricing
Alternative methods for deriving partial differential equations for option prices. Feynman-Kac theorem. Classification of partial differential equations, main properties.
Computing the price of an option with a given accuracy by MC method.
The procedure of changing variables in an Partial Differential Equation.
Implementation of a finite difference method for boundary value problem of ordinary differential equation.
Explicit finite difference method for solving the heat equation. Stability.
Transforming Black-Scholes equation to the standard heat equation. Special solutions of Black-Sholes equation. Explicit finite difference method for transformed BS equation.
The stability of the explicit finite difference method. Derivation of the basic implicit finite difference.
Explicit finite difference method for solving the transformed Black-Scholes equation.
Stability of the basic implicit method. Crank-Nicolson method. Solvin the untransformed Black-Scholes equation by finite difference methods.
Using the explicit method in the case of variable volatility. Constructing effective artificial boundary conditions by using special solutions.
A procedure for computing option prices with a given accuracy.
Basic implicit method for transformed and untransformed equations. Runge's method for estimating the discretisation error.
Computing the price of an option with a given accuracy
Pricing American options. Types of Asian options
Pricing American options
Types of Asian options Derivation a Partial Differential Equation for Asian options. Special solutions.

Derivation of a finite difference method for Asian options.
Artificial boundary conditions for Asian options. Procedure of computing prices with a given accuracy
Verifying the correctness of replicating strategies in the case of real stock price data by trade simulations
Multi-stock options. An explicit finite difference method for pricing options depending on two underlyings.
Pricing Asian options
Practice final examination
Review of the matherial
